main.name: Jeffrey So
main.description: Graduated from the University of Toronto with a Bachelors in Computer Science.
main.bio: I am a gamer at heart. I love learning and understanding the mechanics of video games in order to improve my performance, exploiting my knowledge about the game to gain a competitive edge (until it gets patched out). With First Person Shooters, being my genre of choice, it enables me to throttle my brain to come up with creative solutions to heat-of-the-moment problems. Similarly with coding, I enjoy figuring out how programs and tools work and the creative freedom that coding offers in terms of the solution to any 1 problem. Adhereing to my inner competitive gamer paradigm, if a problem is not inherently impossible to solve, my stubborness allows me to persist until I achieve satisfaction.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.degree: Bachelors of Science, Specializing in Software Engineering

work.title: Full-Stack Developer / Computer Science Tutor
work.description: Mainly as a part-time position, to keep my skills from rusting during Covid-19, I am assisting in the creation of a web platform for EoK so that they can migrate their teaching material onto an online platform to adhere to current world-wide safety protocols. Additionally, I am teaching various highschool students the basics of programming using Python or basic Object Oriented Programming using Java.

work.title: Front-End Web Developer
work.description: Working for Fidelity Clearing Canada, gave me one of the first opportunities to work alongside the rest of the team in an Agile environment, as well as psudo full stack development. Although I was primarily responsible for building front-end SPA pages using the Angular framework, I was occasionally given the opportunity to work with the back-end developers to learn and write the SQL queries and respective APIs needed to build the pages I was in charge of.

work.title: Technical Analyst
work.description: During my time here at IFDS, I worked with fellow student co-ops in validating and updating automation processes currently being used throughout our department. This involved syncing up different enviroments, migrating new code bases to old environments as well as cleaning out outdated or left over scripts.

work.title: Programmer Analyst
work.description: For the majority of my time working at CI Financial, I was tasked with assisting in the automation of a handful of legacy bash scripts using the automation tool AutoSys. Along with making minor updates to modernize certain depreciated methods, I assisted in setting-up, deploying, and maintaining the processes for my respective code bases.

projects.title: Elements of Knowledge Arcade
projects.category: Online Learning Platform for all courses offered by EOK

projects.title: TimeTaBros
projects.category: A school project designed to be a fusion between timetable scheduler and digital community
